metadata.title: CVE-2021-46985 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ACPI:scan: Fix a memory leak in an error handling path If'acpi_device_set_name()' fails, we must free 'acpi_device_bus_id->bus_id'or there is a (potential) memory leak.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46985` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-151-generic - 4.15.0-151.157
linux-image-4.15.0-151-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-151.157
linux-image-4.15.0-151-lowlatency - 4.15.0-151.157
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-151-generic - 4.15.0-151.157
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-151-lowlatency - 4.15.0-151.157
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-80-generic - 5.4.0-80.90~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-80-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-80.90~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-80-lowlatency - 5.4.0-80.90~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-80-generic - 5.4.0-80.90~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-80-lowlatency - 5.4.0-80.90~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1097-kvm - 4.15.0-1097.99
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1109-aws - 4.15.0-1109.116
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1121-azure - 4.15.0-1121.134
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1055-azure - 5.4.0-1055.57~18.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-151.157').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-80.90~18.04.1').
